[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Panic propagation] The processor.run() call at lines 57-60 uses expect() which panics on unexpected exit, but can an attacker exploit gaps in error handling in the processor module to trigger this panic repeatedly, creating a denial-of-service condition for the file store service? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Error recovery] Since run() returns Ok(()) immediately after processor.run() exits at line 61, does this mask critical errors from the processor that should be propagated to the framework, potentially hiding data loss or corruption issues?
